reviews.review_msg: Goat, was so clear on how we would be tested and graded, knew when we needed to do in class examples to clarify harder concepts, and tried to make lectures engaging and funny
The best prof SFU has. Nice, approachable and fair plus knows his stuff.

Very funny teacher!  Class was always interesting and interacted with students a lot during class.  Sometimes was not super clear during class but if you asked he would usually come back to a point in the next class.  Very approachable in office hours and really wants to help students do well and succeed.  Super nice guy, would recommend!
One of the best prof's out there in Chemistry. Really good notes, good lecture, wants you to learn! He will sit down with you until you understand the material. Make sure you get this guy!!!!
his exam are very close to his problem sets.unlike some prof go complete between exam and lecture. if u study u will do good.
Amazing Prof! Great notes and gives 4 quizzes, which totally make you study and thus remember everything for when the final comes. Best prof to have for Inorganic Chemisrty!

Dr. Leznoff had great energy and is a really good prof. there were 4 quizzes and he marked each one very carefully and wrote lots of notes on each person's quiz. Very helpful guy. Take this course with him he really cares about his students and is a lot of fun.
I dont know that I have seen anyone more excited about chemistry.. he even wore his "heavy metals" shirt. Really friendly, and enthusiastic.  Who needs a text book then?

Although it's his first time to teach the course, he communicates materials quite well, and always there for extra help even during the reading break. Midterm is reasonable and not suprising, and focus on understanding rather than remembering. Definitely will take further courses with him

Amazing professor and my favourite so far at SFU. I transferred from Douglas and his class was the first in-person lecture I had there. During the atmospheric river that happened, I was worried the nearby river to my house would flood and I would have to evacuate. Dr Storr was going to cancel his class to help if anything happened too!

Tim is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Super interesting stuff that he talks about as "extras" in the class relating to his reasearch. Also, super nice guy and accessible at all times. He takes things out of the textbook problems for exams and also posts super useful exam practice questions which can show up too. I love this guy.

Tim is a super nice guy and a really good prof, def cares about his students. Can def do this course without the textbook, just make sure u take good notes in his lectures and really pay attention. Provides you with plenty of good practice material and is a fair marker.

He is a good teacher but the course is difficult and the exams are difficult too. He did go through lots of materials in class but very quickly. Students usually have to read a lot and figure out things by themselves.
Great professor who genuinely cares about his students' succeeding. Tests and marking were fair. Looking forward to taking more classes with him.
Great professor. He is a light hearted guy and keeps the class interesting. One of the best, if not the best professor I have had.

One of the most organized and helpful professors ever. He always brings extra sets of notes to class, keeps his office hours, and every question asked will be answered (if he doesn't know right away, he comes back next time with the answer). Also, his exams have no surprises as he's covered all the aspects in class.
Best prof. He is so organized and answers any question you have...and then comes in the next day with another answer just to make sure you understand.

Very organized and even brings extra copies of notes for students. Very helpful, keeps lots of hours available for students. Fair exams. Presents material very well. He's a bit serious at first, but lightens up later. Great job for (I think) his first term teaching here. Should have him teach other classes!
Good teacher overall ! Fair midterm but the final is too hard

I thought he was unorgainzed in he teaching. I don't think I really learned much other than the periodic table which was one thing we were tested on. Problem sets were hard but the tests were representative of the problem sets which was fair. Overall, I didn't like his disorganization and that made me not learn the material
he did not give us the materials that we should have to prepare the finals. the fianl was out of my preparations.

Good prof, he kept the lectures interesting answering the weirdest, hardest and most stupid questions in a very appropriate manner. Tests were similar to the notes and homework slightly harder, he gave us at least 10% by telling us to learn this and that. Very clear and makes the class interesting. I think hes the best chem prof at SFU.

A good professor he is interested in the subject, exams were very fair and lectures were very interesting if u listened and attended class. He uses the chalk board which is old-fashioned but great. Text book was ok and problem sets were interesting.

A good professor he is interested in the subject, exams were very fair and lectures were very interesting if u listened and attended class. He uses the chalk board which is old-fashioned but great. Text book was ok and problem sets were interesting.

he can't explain anything to save his life! he goes on about the confusing theories behind everything which doesn't help you solve questions. however, he did make the mid terms easy. he just copied most of the homework questions. avoid him if u can.

Very nice guy and lectures were decently engaging but his lecture notes didn't go over the topics in nearly enough length or detail (and desperately needed to be proofread). Exams were hard but mostly because he marked harshly - you only got full marks if you wrote down absolutely everything related to the (vaguely worded) questions.

He seemed like a 'nice guy' at the first place. After a while left struggling with this class. The midterms were brutal and the grading was tough as well. Not very clear at explaining lecture material, so often got confused. Going through textbook made much more sense. Lectures themselves are boring. Enough to say. One of the worst classes ever.
I love his class. Best prof i ever had Thanks for the help
He is an awesome prof and makes Chemistry interesting

really good prof..very helpful...hard but very fair midterms and final..everything os from the notes/problem sets...very approachable and gives extra help if needed...genuinley seems like he cares and wants students to do well

Course material is easy, but his questions on the midterms and finals are vague and hard.  It's like bio class, spill everything you know about the subject and you'll get a mark!  Not very fair marking, some questions are worth less (or more) than it should.  Final is worth 60%.
